feedback.Physical Object: Included — A discrete, preserved structure with clear material boundaries.
feedback.Synthetic: Excluded — Formed by natural mineralization, not by design.
feedback.Biological/Biomimetic: Included — Originates from formerly living organisms.
feedback.Powered: Excluded — Inert; does not require or emit energy.
feedback.Structural: Included — Often preserves supporting anatomy such as bone or shell.
feedback.Observable: Included — Perceptible via human senses or instruments.
feedback.Physical Medium: Included — Composed of matter (rock, mineral, or organic remains).
feedback.Active: Excluded — No autonomous behavior or internal dynamism.
feedback.Intentionally Designed: Excluded — Not created with purpose or plan.
feedback.Outputs Effect: Excluded — Does not emit force, signal, or information.
feedback.Processes Signals/Logic: Excluded — No logic handling or data processing.
feedback.State-Transforming: Excluded — Static in structure unless externally altered.
feedback.Human-Interactive: Excluded — Not designed for interactive use.
feedback.System-integrated: Excluded — Not a component in a designed system.
feedback.Functionally Autonomous: Excluded — No internal control or operation.
feedback.System-Essential: Excluded — Not a required part of any defined system.
feedback.Symbolic: Excluded — Symbolic interpretations are cultural, not intrinsic.
feedback.Signalling: Excluded — Does not convey structured meaning intentionally.
feedback.Rule-governed: Excluded — Follows natural physics, not logical rules.
feedback.Compositional: Excluded — Not organized into abstract modules.
feedback.Normative: Excluded — Does not influence behavior or values directly.
feedback.Temporal: Included — Its identity is defined by age and geological time.
feedback.Social Construct: Excluded — Exists independently of belief or agreement.
feedback.Institutionally Defined: Excluded — Classification exists, but identity is not institution-dependent.
feedback.Identity-Linked: Excluded — Not tied to identity, role, or group.
feedback.Regulated: Excluded — May be managed, but not inherently subject to regulation.
feedback.Economically Significant: Included — Fossils have market, tourism, and educational value.
feedback.Politicised: Excluded — Political conflict is external to the fossil’s identity.
feedback.Ritualised: Excluded — Not part of ritual practice in its own right.
feedback.Ethically Significant: Included — Extraction, sale, and cultural ownership raise ongoing ethical issues.

encoding_notes: This encoding represents a fossil as a preserved physical remnant of biological life, defined by its deep-time provenance. It includes ethical and economic relevance tied to its real-world material status, but excludes symbolic and systemic overlays.
